intro: Lasiandra setulosa, commonly known as the hairy lasiandra, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, clustered white or pink flowers. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in coastal and inland regions. Lasiandra setulosa is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and adaptability to various environmental conditions.
